title: Assessment – Mastery and Reflection
goals: Assess accuracy and fluency with Second Conjugation verbs
Compare both verb families through chant and translation
Reflect on the virtue Prudentia and faithful learning

steps.speak: Salve! Today is our mastery review. Begin with both families: amō, amās, amat / videō, vidēs, videt.
Excellent! Chant the full endings for –ēre verbs: eō, ēs, et / ēmus, ētis, ent.
Translate these aloud: Puella videt aquam. Puer amat Deum. Agricola habet librum.
Answers: The girl sees the water. The boy loves God. The farmer has a book. Excellent work!
Mini reflection: Which verb family has long ē sounds? Which has short a sounds?
Faith phrase together: Deus videt – God sees. Think of how God sees our careful study and effort.
Virtue reflection: Diligence (Week 11) taught careful effort; Prudence (Week 12) teaches wise seeing. Together they make faithful learning.
Closing prayer: Gratias tibi, Deus, pro sapientiā et diligentiā – Thank you, God, for wisdom and diligence.
Bene factum! Next week we will meet the –ere family—the Third Conjugation verbs.
